poem:
**The Cost of Understanding**

Youth draped in innocence,  
yet blind to the currency's game,  
where forms flutter  
like autumn leaves—  
P60 and P45—  
cryptic symbols  
written in the script  
of bureaucrats.  
Lost in the ledger's labyrinth,  
they tread the unknown,  
each step  
a lesson  
etched in the parchment  
of tomorrow's toil.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Here’s one life skill that will come in handy | Letters One lesson in any new “life skills” curriculum (Report, 4 November) should be on teaching school leavers about HMRC and taxation of their future personal earnings. As an employer, I regularly find comprehension of how PAYE, national insurance, tax codes and student loans are calculated is minimal. An understanding of what P6, P9, P60, P45 and P85 forms are for would help students transition". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
